questions.question: Group of organs working together to perform a specific function is called:
questions.answer: Organ system

questions.question: Which system supplies oxygen to cells?
questions.answer: Respiratory system

questions.question: Which organ filters air entering the body?
questions.answer: Nose

questions.question: Which pipe carries air to lungs?
questions.answer: Trachea

questions.question: Tiny air sacs in lungs are called:
questions.answer: Alveoli

questions.question: Gas exchange occurs in:
questions.answer: Alveoli

questions.question: Which protein carries oxygen in blood?
questions.answer: Hemoglobin

questions.question: Muscular partition between thorax and abdomen is:
questions.answer: Diaphragm

questions.question: Heart is located:
questions.answer: Between two lungs

questions.question: Human heart has how many chambers?
questions.answer: Four

questions.question: Upper chambers of heart are called:
questions.answer: Atria

questions.question: Blood vessels carrying blood away from heart are:
questions.answer: Arteries

questions.question: Which vessels have valves?
questions.answer: Veins

questions.question: Exchange of materials occurs in:
questions.answer: Capillaries

questions.question: Normal heart beat per minute in adult is:
Red color of blood is due to:
questions.answer: Hemoglobin

questions.question: Which blood cells fight infection?
questions.answer: WBC

questions.question: Blood clotting is done by:
questions.answer: Platelets

questions.question: Liquid part of blood is:
questions.answer: Plasma

questions.question: Universal donor blood group is:
questions.answer: O

questions.question: Universal recipient blood group is:
questions.answer: AB

questions.question: Instrument used to measure blood pressure:
questions.answer: Sphygmomanometer

questions.question: High blood pressure is called:
questions.answer: Hypertension

questions.question: Branch of science related to blood study:
questions.answer: Hematology

questions.question: Blood is produced in:
questions.answer: Red bone marrow

questions.question: Blood donation day is observed on:
questions.answer: 1 October

questions.question: Blood donation helps in:
questions.answer: Saving lives

questions.question: Pregnant women should not donate blood because:
questions.answer: Health risk

questions.question: Which carries CO₂ to lungs?
questions.answer: RBC

questions.question: Blood vessel connecting heart and lungs:
questions.answer: Pulmonary artery

questions.question: Which side of heart pumps oxygenated blood?
questions.answer: Left side

questions.question: Blood returning to heart enters:
questions.answer: Atrium

questions.question: Which blood component helps in immunity?
questions.answer: WBC

questions.question: Blood clotting protein is:
questions.answer: Fibrinogen

questions.question: Blood transports hormones from:
questions.answer: Source to target organ

questions.question: Which gas is removed during exhalation?
questions.answer: Carbon dioxide

questions.question: During inhalation diaphragm moves:
questions.answer: Downwards

questions.question: Which system transports nutrients?
questions.answer: Circulatory

questions.question: Blood pressure during contraction is:
questions.answer: Systolic

questions.question: Blood donation volume is about:
questions.answer: 350 ml

questions.question: RBC life span is about:
questions.answer: 120 days

questions.question: Blood groups are determined by:
questions.answer: Genes

questions.question: Who discovered blood groups?
questions.answer: Carl Landsteiner

questions.question: Blood circulation theory was proposed by:
questions.answer: William Harvey

questions.question: Blood is classified as:
questions.answer: Connective tissue

questions.question: Which helps in thermoregulation?
questions.answer: Blood circulation

questions.question: Which organ system removes wastes?
questions.answer: Excretory

questions.question: What is respiration?
questions.answer: Respiration is the process of taking in oxygen and releasing carbon dioxide. It helps in releasing energy from food.

questions.question: Name the main organs of respiratory system.
questions.answer: Nose, trachea, bronchi and lungs are the main organs of respiratory system.

questions.question: What is inhalation?
questions.answer: Inhalation is the process of taking oxygen-rich air into lungs. Diaphragm moves downward during inhalation.

questions.question: What is exhalation?
questions.answer: Exhalation is the process of releasing carbon dioxide from lungs. Diaphragm moves upward during this process.

questions.question: What is the function of alveoli?
questions.answer: Alveoli provide large surface area for exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide between blood and air.

questions.question: Why are alveoli surrounded by capillaries?
questions.answer: Capillaries help in fast diffusion of gases between blood and alveoli walls.

questions.question: What is circulation?
questions.answer: Circulation is movement of blood through heart and blood vessels to supply oxygen and nutrients.

questions.question: What is the function of heart?
questions.answer: Heart pumps blood to all parts of the body and maintains continuous circulation.

questions.question: Why heart is called pumping organ?
questions.answer: It contracts and relaxes continuously to pump blood throughout the body.

questions.question: What are atria?
questions.answer: Atria are upper chambers of heart that receive blood coming into heart.

questions.question: What are ventricles?
questions.answer: Ventricles are lower chambers of heart that pump blood out of the heart.

questions.question: What is double circulation?
questions.answer: Blood passes through heart twice in one cycle. It includes pulmonary and systemic circulation.

questions.question: What is pulmonary circulation?
questions.answer: Blood flows between heart and lungs for oxygenation in pulmonary circulation.

questions.question: What is systemic circulation?
questions.answer: Blood flows between heart and rest of body parts in systemic circulation.

questions.question: What are arteries?
questions.answer: Arteries carry oxygen-rich blood away from heart and have thick elastic walls.

questions.question: What are veins?
questions.answer: Veins carry blood back to heart and contain valves to prevent backflow.

questions.question: What are capillaries?
questions.answer: Capillaries are thin vessels where exchange of gases and nutrients occurs.

questions.question: What is blood?
questions.answer: Blood is a connective tissue that transports gases, nutrients, hormones and wastes.

questions.question: What are components of blood?
questions.answer: Plasma, red blood cells, white blood cells and platelets are components of blood.

questions.question: What is plasma?
questions.answer: Plasma is liquid part of blood that carries nutrients, hormones and waste materials.

questions.question: What is function of RBC?
questions.answer: RBC carry oxygen using hemoglobin and transport carbon dioxide to lungs.

questions.question: What is function of WBC?
questions.answer: WBC protect body against infections and destroy pathogens.

questions.question: What is function of platelets?
questions.answer: Platelets help in blood clotting and prevent excessive bleeding.

questions.question: What is blood clotting?
questions.answer: It is process of stopping bleeding by forming clot at wound site.

questions.question: What is hemoglobin?
questions.answer: Hemoglobin is red pigment in RBC that carries oxygen.

questions.question: What is anemia?
questions.answer: Anemia is condition of low hemoglobin causing weakness and fatigue.

questions.question: What are blood groups?
questions.answer: Blood is classified into A, B, AB and O groups based on antigens.

questions.question: Why blood grouping is important?
questions.answer: To avoid reaction during blood transfusion and ensure safety.

questions.question: What is blood transfusion?
questions.answer: Transfer of blood from donor to patient is blood transfusion.

questions.question: What is blood pressure?
questions.answer: Pressure exerted by blood on artery walls is blood pressure.

questions.question: What is systolic pressure?
questions.answer: Pressure during contraction of heart is systolic pressure.

questions.question: What is diastolic pressure?
questions.answer: Pressure during relaxation of heart is diastolic pressure.

questions.question: What is hypertension?
questions.answer: Persistent high blood pressure is called hypertension.

questions.question: Why blood donation is important?
questions.answer: It saves lives of patients during accidents and surgeries.

questions.question: Who can donate blood?
questions.answer: Healthy adults between 18–60 years with normal weight can donate blood.

questions.question: Why smokers have breathing problems?
questions.answer: Smoking damages lungs and reduces oxygen intake.

questions.question: What is exercise effect on heart?
questions.answer: Exercise strengthens heart and improves blood circulation.

questions.question: What is fitness pulse rate?
questions.answer: Pulse rate after exercise that returns quickly to normal shows good fitness.

questions.question: What is lymph?
questions.answer: Lymph is colorless fluid that returns tissue fluid to blood.

questions.question: Why valves are present in veins?
questions.answer: To prevent backward flow of blood.

questions.question: What is pulse?
questions.answer: Pulse is rhythmic expansion of arteries when heart pumps blood.

questions.question: Where is pulse measured?
questions.answer: At wrist or neck where artery is close to skin.

questions.question: What is transport system?
questions.answer: System that carries materials to and from cells in body.

questions.question: Why oxygen is essential for life?
questions.answer: It helps in releasing energy from food during respiration.

questions.question: Why CO2 is harmful?
questions.answer: High CO2 level disturbs body pH and causes breathing difficulty.

questions.question: What is organ system?
questions.answer: Group of organs working together for specific function.

questions.question: Why coordination between systems is needed?
questions.answer: For proper functioning and survival of body.

questions.question: How lungs are protected?
questions.answer: By rib cage and pleural membranes.

questions.question: What is pleura?
questions.answer: Double membrane covering lungs that reduces friction.

questions.question: What is breathing rate?
questions.answer: Number of breaths taken per minute is breathing rate.

questions.question: Why children have faster breathing rate?
questions.answer: Due to higher energy requirement and faster metabolism.

questions.question: Why heart rate increases during exercise?
questions.answer: To supply more oxygen and nutrients to muscles.

questions.question: What is circulation pathway?
questions.answer: Path through which blood travels in body.

questions.question: Why RBC have no nucleus?
questions.answer: To carry more hemoglobin and transport more oxygen.

questions.question: What is heart beat?
questions.answer: One complete contraction and relaxation of heart is heartbeat.

questions.question: Why heart never stops?
questions.answer: It works continuously to maintain life.

questions.question: What is aerobic respiration?
questions.answer: Respiration using oxygen to release energy.

questions.question: What is anaerobic respiration?
questions.answer: Respiration without oxygen releasing less energy.

questions.question: Why athletes have strong hearts?
questions.answer: Regular exercise strengthens heart muscles.

questions.question: What is ventilation?
questions.answer: Movement of air in and out of lungs.

questions.question: Why iron is needed in diet?
questions.answer: For formation of hemoglobin in blood.

questions.question: What is carbon monoxide poisoning?
questions.answer: CO binds with hemoglobin preventing oxygen transport.

questions.question: Why blood is called life fluid?
questions.answer: It transports vital substances to all parts.

questions.question: Why capillaries are very thin?
questions.answer: To allow easy exchange of materials.

questions.question: What is cardiac cycle?
questions.answer: One complete sequence of heartbeat.

questions.question: Why heart muscles never get tired?
questions.answer: Continuous oxygen supply and special muscle fibers.

questions.question: Why deep breathing is healthy?
questions.answer: It increases oxygen intake and relaxes body.

questions.question: What is fitness index?
questions.answer: Measure of physical fitness based on heart recovery rate.

questions.question: What is circulatory failure?
questions.answer: When blood supply becomes insufficient to organs.

questions.question: Why hydration is important for blood?
questions.answer: Maintains blood volume and circulation.

questions.question: Why lungs are spongy?
questions.answer: Due to presence of many alveoli.

questions.question: What is oxygen debt?
questions.answer: Extra oxygen needed after heavy exercise.

questions.question: Why first aid is needed in bleeding?
questions.answer: To prevent excessive blood loss.

questions.question: Why healthy lifestyle is important?
questions.answer: It keeps heart and lungs strong.

questions.question: Why walking improves circulation?
questions.answer: Muscle movement helps blood flow.

questions.question: Why obesity affects heart?
questions.answer: Extra fat increases workload on heart.

questions.question: Why junk food is harmful?
questions.answer: It increases cholesterol and heart diseases.

questions.question: What is oxygen saturation?
questions.answer: Amount of oxygen bound to hemoglobin.

questions.question: Why medical checkups are important?
questions.answer: To detect heart and blood problems early.

questions.question: What is cardiac arrest?
questions.answer: Sudden stopping of heart function.

questions.question: Why CPR is important?
questions.answer: It helps restore blood circulation during cardiac arrest.

questions.question: What is artificial respiration?
questions.answer: Providing oxygen manually when breathing stops.

questions.question: Why heart disease is increasing?
questions.answer: Due to stress, unhealthy food and lack of exercise.

questions.question: Why yoga is beneficial?
questions.answer: Improves breathing and heart efficiency.

questions.question: Why pollution affects lungs?
questions.answer: Toxins damage lung tissues and reduce oxygen intake.

questions.question: Why blood donation camps are organized?
questions.answer: To ensure sufficient blood supply in hospitals.

questions.question: What is respiratory disease?
questions.answer: Disease affecting breathing and lungs.

questions.question: Why lungs need clean air?
questions.answer: To maintain healthy gas exchange.

questions.question: Why exercise improves lung capacity?
questions.answer: It strengthens breathing muscles.

questions.question: Why balanced diet supports circulation?
questions.answer: Provides nutrients needed for blood formation.

questions.question: Why sleep is important for heart?
questions.answer: It reduces stress and repairs tissues.

questions.question: What is heart fitness test?
questions.answer: Test to check heart response to exercise.

questions.question: Why elderly face breathing problems?
questions.answer: Due to weak lungs and reduced capacity.

questions.question: Why stress affects heart?
questions.answer: It increases blood pressure and heart rate.

questions.question: Why oxygen therapy is given?
questions.answer: To increase oxygen levels in blood.

questions.question: What is heart failure?
questions.answer: Condition where heart cannot pump sufficient blood.

questions.question: Why healthy habits prevent diseases?
questions.answer: They strengthen immunity and organs.

questions.question: Why regular checkup saves life?
questions.answer: Early detection prevents serious complications.

questions.question: Why blood banks are important?
questions.answer: They store blood for emergencies.

questions.question: Give conclusion of organ systems chapter.
questions.answer: Organ systems work together to keep body healthy and alive.
